item.title: Client to Server Packet Size Issue
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Can’t those two values before the String be written as single bytes?

Anyways, because you’re writing a String, the packet’s size will vary depending on the length of the String.
So before you send any of the data, you first must send a byte telling the server how long the packet will be (12 + (send.length() + 1)).
The whole thing should look like this:

stream.writeFrame(218);
stream.writeByte(12 + (send.length() + 1));
stream.writeQWord(TextClass.longForName(reportAbuseInput));
stream.writeWordBigEndian(j - 601);
stream.writeWordBigEndian(canMute ? 1 : 0);
stream.writeString(send);

You’ll also need to change the packet size in the server to -1 so that it knows it is a byte variable-sized frame.
